docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Nov. 3. -- The provisional political situation in Catalonia must evolve into something more definite in the near future. Colonel Francesco Jimenez is acting head of the regional government, while Luis Companys, who was president of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Nov. 3. -- The provisional political situation in Catalonia must evolve into something more definite in the near future. Colonel Francesco Jimenez is acting head of the regional government, while Luis Companys, who was president of the rebellious Generalidad, is a prisoner aboard the warship Uruguay in Barcelona Harbor, awaiting trial.
docs.abstract: Pol situation as result of rebellion; elections to regional Cortes to fill vacant Leftist seats must be held; Cath Popular Actionists organizing branch of party; liberties curtailed; autonomy statute to be revised in Madrid Cortes

headline.main: CATALAN ELECTION WILL BE HELD SOON; Seats of Rebellious Leftist Deputies Must Be Filled in Regional Cortes.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 7. -- Sir John Simon, Secretary for Foreign Affairs, denied today a charge made at the arms inquiry in Washington that a British Ambassador was involved in the sale of arms to the police force of Montevideo. The charge was made by...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 7. -- Sir John Simon, Secretary for Foreign Affairs, denied today a charge made at the arms inquiry in Washington that a British Ambassador was involved in the sale of arms to the police force of Montevideo. The charge was made by Carlton Rich of the Federal Laboratories, Inc., and was "entirely untrue," according to Sir John.
docs.abstract: Sir J Simon denies charge made by C Rich, at Sen inquiry, that Brit Ambassador was involved in sale of arms to police force of Montevideo

headline.main: DENIES BRITISH ENVOY WAS LINKED TO DEAL; Simon Calls 'Entirely Untrue' Charge at Arms Inquiry of Alleged Montevideo Sale.
